Style variables

Choerodon-ui design specifications and technology support flexible style customization to meet the diverse visual needs of business and branding. It defines a series of global/component style variables that you can adjust accordingly according to your needs.

In different versions, we support two variable schemes:

  • less variable scheme: The component library only supports the less variable scheme in versions 1.5.8 and earlier.
  • CSS Variable version variable scheme: The component library version 1.6.0 supports the CSS variable scheme, and the configuration variables dynamically update the style of the component.
  • Default style variable

If the above variables cannot meet your customization needs, you can submit an issue to us.

Variable switching

The default variable scheme of the component library is pure less variables, and it supports configuration switching to CSS Variable variable scheme.

Switch method, set the variable switching plug-in provided by the component library in the project webpack config, and set the parameters:

//Introduce component library switching variable mode plug-in
const SetC7nRootEntryNamePlugin = require('choerodon-ui/outer-scripts/SetC7nRootEntryNamePlugin');
module.exports = {
   ...,
   plugins: [
     ...,
+ //Set the variable switching plug-in provided by the component library
+ new SetC7nRootEntryNamePlugin({
+ 'c7n-root-entry-name': 'variables', // css variable scheme
+ // 'c7n-root-entry-name': 'defaultVars', // Pure less variable scheme (default)
+ }),
   ],
}

HZERO framework configuration solution reference: Upgrade UED 5.x Guide

CSS variable customization

In CSS Variables pattern, we call the smallest element that affects the theme a Design Token. By modifying the Design Token, we can present a variety of themes or components.

Before setting CSS variables, please be sure to review the Design Token Guide, which helps to quickly understand and avoid pitfalls! ! !

Design Token acquisition and use

  1. Use of style sheet files
@import '~choerodon-ui/lib/style/themes/default'; //Introduce component library global style variables
// Use component library variables in style files as needed
.custom {
     button {
         color: @btn-primary-color;
         background-color: @btn-primary-bg;
         border-color: @btn-primary-border;
     }
     .test {
         font-size: @font-size-lg;
         background-color: @component-background;
     }
}
  1. Obtain variables and use them in JS

The component library provides a method to obtain Design Token (CSS variable value). You can obtain the returned variable value based on the passed in variable name or array of variable names.

import { getValueByCssVars } from 'choerodon-ui/lib/config-css-vars';

// Get by variable name
const val = getValueByCssVars('primary-color');
console.log(val); // { 'primary-color': 'xxx' }

// Get through variable name array
const val = getValueByCssVars(['primary-color', 'btn-padding-left']);
console.log(val); // { 'primary-color': 'xxx', 'btn-padding-left': 'xxxx' }

Using the CSS variable scheme, dynamically switching themes is very simple for users. We have also customized multiple sets of themes, which can be used with the component library through the UED project.

More references:

  • Theme switching
  • CSS Variable Theme Scheme User Manual

less customization method

We use modifyVars to override variables. In specific engineering practice, there are two options: package.theme and less, just choose one.

1) theme attribute (recommended)

Configured in the theme field under package.json or .webpackrc. theme can be configured as an object or file path.

"theme": {
   "primary-color": "#1DA57A",
},

Notice:

  • Styles must be loaded in less format.

    • If you are using the style configuration of babel-plugin-import to introduce styles, you need to change the configuration value from 'css' Change to true, which will import the less file.
    • If you introduced styles via 'choerodon-ui/dist/choerodon-ui.css``, change tochoerodon-ui/dist/choerodon-ui.less`.
  • The theme attribute of dva-cli@0.7.0+ needs to be written in the .roadhogrc file.
  • If you want to override the @icon-url variable, the content needs to include quotes "@icon-url": "'your-icon-font-path'" (Correction example).

2) less

Use less files for variable coverage.

Create a separate less file as follows, and then import this file.

@import '~choerodon-ui/dist/choerodon-ui.less'; //Introduce the officially provided less style entry file
@import 'your-theme-file.less'; // Used to override the variables defined above

Note: This method has already loaded the styles of all components, and is not required and cannot be used with the style attribute of the on-demand loading plugin babel-plugin-import.
